title: Whitby to Ruswarp Circular Walk Route

nearby.description: Whitby to Robin Hoods Bay on the Cinder Track

images.title: Paul Buckingham / River Esk near Whitby
images.caption: River Esk near Whitby Taken from the railway bridge - now a footpath and cycle track- interesting view of a ramshackle boat yard.

images.title: Ian Petticrew, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Larpool Viaduct over the River Esk between Whitby and Ruswarp. The impressive 13 arch structure was built in 1882 to carry the Scarborough & Whitby Railway over the River Esk.

images.title: Mick Garratt / River Esk and Ruswarp Bridge
images.caption: River Esk and Ruswarp Bridge. The village of Ruswarp is on the far bank with the tower of St. Bartholomew's church prominent.

images.title: Peter Church / Railway by the River Esk
images.caption: Railway by the River Esk. The railway engineers used the gentle gradients of the river to overcome the hilliness of the local terrain. This image from high up near the A171 road bridge is rich in detail. Many yachts are still out of the water prior to summer outings. Pantile rooftops are typical in this area. The ruined abbey stands on the skyline.

images.title: Mick Garratt / High Street, Ruswarp
images.caption: View south along High Street, Ruswarp, North Yorkshire. The Post Office is on the left and the tower of St Bartholomew's parish church is ahead.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Ruswarp Station
images.caption: Ruswarp Station. The station house and ticket office are now private residences.

images.title: Dr Neil Clifton / Rowing boats, River Esk near Ruswarp
images.caption: Rowing boats, River Esk near Ruswarp

images.title: Mick Garratt / Footpath to Ruswarp
images.caption: Footpath to Ruswarp. This paved way must be an ancient route between Ruswarp and Whitby. Here looking back to Ruswarp with St. Bartholomew's tower rising above the village.

description: This pleasant circular trail explores the area to the south of Whitby. On the way there's lovely views of the Esk Estuary and the heritage steam trains running along the Esk Valley Railway. Starting at Whitby train station you pick up the Esk Valley Walk and follow it south past Fishburn Park and Boghall towards the neighbouring village of Ruswarp. The route follows the opening section of the Esk Valley Railway which runs heritage trains through the North York Moors to Middlesbrough. In the village of Ruswarp you'll find an old station on the line and a 120ft high viaduct, which was built to carry the now closed Scarborough to Whitby railway line. Known as the Larpool Viaduct it is now owned by Sustrans and carries the Cinder Track, a shared cycling and walking trail runnning to Robin Hood's Bay. In Ruswarp you'll also find an old church, a good range of shops and a local pub. After exploring the village you then cross the railway line to follow country lanes round to the viaduct. You can then cross back to the other side while enjoying fine views over the countryside from the impressive structure. The route then retraces its steps back into Whitby.
